image.altText: A picture of a smiling man's face, attached to a wooden cross outside.

items.synopsis: At the Krasnopilske military cemetery in eastern Ukraine, one of the first things you hear is weeping — the women here all know each other, but they're bound together for devastating reasons.

title.children: Ukraine doesn't release its number of war casualties — at this cemetery, the real toll is on show

image.altText: Ozioma Onyekwere wears a pink shirt and Mary Ellen Kemister wears a striped shirt

items.synopsis: Permanent residency for aged care workers recruited from overseas is being fast-tracked by the government in a bid to address a jobs crisis in the sector, but at the same time, "high-quality" temporary workers are being made to leave the country.

title.children: Ozioma's heart lies in Australia, but a 'blanket rule' means she'll soon have to leave her job

image.altText: The city's skyline and sun overlook the Brisbane sign in Southport.

items.synopsis: Queensland is the top destination for those seeking a new adventure in their golden years, according to data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Aussie retirees flocking to Queensland in record numbers, data reveals

image.altText: Flowers grave Wagner Yevgeny Prigozhin after funeral

items.synopsis: A Kremlin spokesperson said funeral plans for the Wagner chief who died in a plane crash last week were up to relatives.

title.children: Mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin buried on outskirts of St Petersburg

image.altText: Anthonty Albanese wearing a pink shirt and a wide brimmed hat surrounded by red flags and people in body paint.

items.synopsis: The prime minister will today announce when Australians will head to the polls to vote on whether to enshrine the Voice to Parliament in the constitution.

title.children: Prime minister to name date for Voice referendum

image.altText: AI generated images of women from South Asia and East Asia

items.synopsis: AI-generated images of "beautiful" women from around the world have been going viral on TikTok. But some say they're based off stereotypes and can perpetuate colourist ideals.

title.children: Is there such thing as 'looking like' your ethnicity? These viral AI images think so

image.altText: A young man sitting on his desk.

items.synopsis: The City of Gold Coast councillor accused of killing his stepfather could be released as early as next week, as lawyers call for him to be placed into protective custody while awaiting his bail hearing.

title.children: Gold Coast councillor Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden to seek early bail on murder charge

image.altText: A man looks on.

items.synopsis: When Luis Rubiales grabbed Jenni Hermoso's face and kissed her on the lips during post-match celebrations at Stadium Australia, Spaniards were forced to pick a side, and start a national conversation about chauvinism.

title.children: 'Something deeply rotten': Soccer, chauvinism and the national conversation Spain had to have

image.altText: A close-up of a fire truck, with 'fire and rescue' written on red paint

items.synopsis: A 12-year-old boy is in custody after being found near the home by police.

title.children: Child charged with arson after allegedly starting blaze that destroyed Whitsundays home

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and glasses stares out the window while grasping a cup of tea.

items.synopsis: Analysis of Federal Court data has found 10 per cent of all forced bankruptcies across Australia are from strata levy debts.

title.children: 'Little to no consumer safeguards': when it comes to strata debt

image.altText: Three Brisbane Broncos NRL players embrace as they celebrate a try.

items.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers have a great chance at nabbing the minor premiership after Brisbane announced a completely revamped side to face a similarly unrecognisable Storm team in the last round of the season.

title.children: Broncos show little regard for NRL minor premiership, resting almost all their rep stars for final round

image.altText: police standing in between rocks with fast rushing water around them

items.synopsis: Second bone found by police divers in Mossman Gorge where a woman disappeared in January

title.children: Second bone found by police in Far North Queensland swimming spot

image.altText: A low Earth orbit satellite

items.synopsis: After the Black Summer fires, experts called for a way of detecting bushfires more rapidly, using satellites. But executing this idea faces challenges.

title.children: Space-based rapid bushfire detection was slated for 2025 delivery. But it may have hit a snag

image.altText: A bin catching on fire in the back of a garbage truck

items.synopsis: The use of lithium battery-powered products in New South Wales is increasing, and so too is the rise in house fires caused by them.

title.children: Toxic fumes from lithium battery-ignited fires can be deadly. Here's what you should do

image.altText: Archival image, wide-shot, of trees, beach and water on Banaba island, Kiribati.

items.synopsis: People from the remote Pacific Island of Banaba say they've been blindsided over an agreement to explore phosphate mining on the tiny atoll and Centrex, an Australian mining company, inked the exploration deal.

title.children: 'We just don't want mining': Australian company under fire from Banaban locals displaced by past phosphate mines

image.altText: Madison is holding a binder and smiling.

items.synopsis: As cost-of-living pressures continue to climb, people are looking for creative ways to save. One method gaining popularity on social media is called "cash stuffing". It's a reinvention of the old envelope system our grandparents used to use, and it's bringing back the use of physical cash.

title.children: Madison says she'll never use her card full-time again after discovering 'cash stuffing'

image.altText: Wooden marionette and shadows.

items.synopsis: In the beginning, he was charming, gentle and caring — but after she and her two children moved in with him, everything changed. Coercive control was at the centre of their relationship — with a court in Hobart hearing from three other victims of the same man.

title.children: 'You used and abused these women as you pleased': Hugs in court as man jailed over repeated abuse

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

items.synopsis: Student protesters interrupt the beginning of a speech by incoming RBA governor Michele Bullock, taking issue with her past comment about needing to see the unemployment rate rise.

title.children: Protesters interrupt incoming RBA boss for wanting '140,000 people' to lose their jobs

image.altText: American sprinter Noah Lyles holds up three fingers and yells after a race at the athletics world championships.

items.synopsis: After more than a century, US athletics superstar Noah Lyles is within his rights to be sick of teams being dubbed "world champions" for winning American sporting leagues, writes Jon Healy.

title.children: 'That ain't the world': Why this US sprint star is copping flak from NBA stars who call themselves 'world champions'

image.altText: Photo of Tracy Sorensen, who has brown eyes and is smiling to the camera with faded green background

items.synopsis: When author Tracy Sorensen realised she didn't know much about her body parts that were affected by cancer, she found a unique way to learn — and write — about them.

title.children: 'Cole the Colon', an angry spleen and a loved-up tumour: A new cancer memoir is anything but by the book

image.altText: An elderly couple down a mall with the help of a younger woman.

items.synopsis: I've read the 300-odd pages of the Intergenerational Report pretty carefully and, with the exception of the section on climate change, I'm yet to find anything particularly alarming, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Australia isn't quite facing the 'ageing time bomb' alarmist headlines would have you believe

image.altText: A plane on a tar mac with a sunset backdrop

items.synopsis: Captain Eleanor V LeBeau, Corporal Spencer R Collart and Major Tobin J Lewis were killed in a military training exercise when their aircraft crashed and caught fire on Sunday.

title.children: Bodies of US marines killed in Tiwi Islands Osprey crash flown into Darwin

image.altText: Mechelle wears a top with an Indigenous pattern as she speaks at an official police press conference

items.synopsis: Mechelle Turvey starts delivering training sessions to police recruits that she hopes will help them be more sensitive when dealing with victims of crime. WARNING: This story features the name and image of a deceased Aboriginal person.

title.children: 'I choose not to hate': Mother of Indigenous schoolboy Cassius Turvey delivering 'raw' training to police recruits

image.altText: A steelworks site with gas pipe flame flare, sky with scattering of clouds, dusk.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court fines BlueScope for engaging in cartel conduct over the supply of a product that is an essential material for builders, manufacturers and the automotive industry.

title.children: BlueScope fined a record $57.5 million over attempted price fixing that could have affected millions of consumers

image.altText: Xavier Cooks dunking the basketball through a hoop.

items.synopsis: Australia's pursuit of men's basketball World Cup gold remains alive with Xavier Cooks dominating in the Boomers' 109-89 defeat of Japan.

title.children: Australia Cooks Japan for crucial World Cup win

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal men and women standing and sitting on a red patch of dirt in front of a small sign

items.synopsis: After more than a decade of negotiations, Broken Hill's Wilyakali people have had a native title claim officially recognised by the federal court. The claim expands from the Barrier Ranges in New South Wales' far west over the border into South Australia.

title.children: Wilyakali people recognised as traditional owners of large patch of SA and NSW land

image.altText: A couple pose in front of a brightly coloured wall with the national emblem of China, holding a bouqet of flowers between them

items.synopsis: A notice on Changshan county's official WeChat account, said the reward was to promote "age-appropriate marriage and child-bearing" for first marriages, the latest measure to incentivise young people to get married amid concern over a declining birth rate.

title.children: Chinese county offers 'cash reward' for couples if bride is 25 or under

image.altText: Six bee hives sitting in amongst the blossoming almond trees

items.synopsis: The NSW DPI will allow beekeepers to move hives in Sunraysia and Riverina purple zones subject to a number of conditions.

title.children: Beehives permitted to move from almond orchard purple zones

image.altText: A white woman, a white man with down syndrome and another white man dance in loose fitting clothing on a stage.

items.synopsis: The 52-year-old choreographer and wheelchair user channelled her experience into an ode to vulnerability, which will open at Sydney Opera House this week before touring to Seoul.

title.children: Michelle transformed a distressing incident with the police into a world-class performance

image.altText: Woman holding baby with head turned away

items.synopsis: Essie Mitchell first spoke to her GP about a lump in her breast when she was 22. But it took 11 years and three more visits before her cancer was finally picked up, by which time it was too late to operate.

title.children: Mum's devastating diagnosis comes too late despite years of tests

image.altText: Several adult whales surrounded by numerous calves, as seen from above.

items.synopsis: A researcher says the reason for the decline is a mystery, but she hopes next year's survey reflects the results of a strong breeding season.

title.children: Southern right whale numbers have plunged on Australia's southern coast

image.altText: Two men in protective suits and masks stand amid a huge indoor cannabis crop.

items.synopsis: The state government says it will make medicinal cannabis easier for doctors to prescribe, but has stopped short of changing drug driving laws to allow for its use.

title.children: WA medicinal cannabis regulations to be reviewed amid call for 'immediate action'
